We go from a white light bulb to lasers without an explanation why.

For anyone wondering, the projector featured in the video is NEC NP-PH1201QL which targets at installation/business market, not for cinema. Also 281 trillion shades of colour quoted in the title is inaccurate, as this particular projector can process up to 12bit colour in each R/G/B channel, then maps them to a 16bit container for display, which makes the maximum amount of colour that can be reproduced on screen (2^12)^3 = 68.7billion shades.
